title: Joseph Signay
text:
Joseph Signay, (8 November 1778 – 3 October 1850), was the third archbishop of the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Archdiocese%20of%20Quebec">Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Quebec</a>.
Signay was ordained in 1802 by Bishop <a href="Pierre%20Denaut">Pierre Denaut</a> and began a number of years of parish duties. In 1814, he was appointed parish priest of Quebec by Archbishop <a href="Joseph-Octave%20Plessis">Joseph-Octave Plessis</a>. In 1825, <a href="Bernard-Claude%20Panet">Bernard-Claude Panet</a> became archbishop and selected Signay as his coadjutor.
Signay became archbishop in 1833 and he was followed by <a href="Pierre-Flavien%20Turgeon">Pierre-Flavien Turgeon</a> in 1850.
